presentation.title: I'm a frontend developer.
presentation.subtitle: Fidel Miranda
presentation.subtitle2: I dedicate myself to creating applications...

aboutMe.title: About Me
aboutMe.text: Being a frontend programmer with +3 years of experience in Javascript, HTML and CSS, I am able to create intuitive and dynamic user interfaces that offer an exceptional user experience. In addition, the acquired skills to work in a team and communicate effectively allow me to collaborate with other developers and designers to create unique and customized solutions for each project.In summary, I am passionate about web design and development, and I am committed to offering innovative and effective solutions for each of my clients.

text.description: Learning to create apk with React-Native and consolidating my knowledge, always learning new things and looking for new challenges.

Here I started using TypeScript, I also strengthened my skills in design and the application of styles with CSS and Sass. I had the opportunity to participate in the development of applications with a high level of design, which has been very enriching. Additionally, I incorporated Figma as a tool for application development, which has allowed me to streamline my workflow and create more effective designs.

I supported the development of an ecommerce, providing code in the backend with ExpressJS and in the frontend with React. During this project, I acquired knowledge about Redis and RabbitMQ, using these technologies to store data in memory and thus provide information to the client quickly. Additionally, I implemented microservices for the different web services.

I was in charge of managing both Windows and Linux servers, with services such as FTP, Apache and Active Directory. Additionally, I contributed by creating applications to solve administration and service problems on said servers. During this experience, I worked with PHP, Node.js and ReactJS.
Work on the design of web pages, book covers, advertising posters and business cards. During my career, I have learned to use tools like CorelDRAW and have consolidated my skills with Photoshop.
I was helping to apply techniques for the security of the company's network, implementing fireworks and configuring servers and switches.

jobs.name: camon
jobs.description: Landing page about CAMON Global Services, using Nextjs and tailwindcss. using best practices for performance, SEO, accessibility and best practices

jobs.name: f-resources
jobs.description: Page listing some of the pages with resources for development, design and documentation for the community of web developers and designers.

jobs.name: KIDSRUS
jobs.description: Ecommerce layout with NextJs and SCSS. The site was designed with NextJs to take advantage of the advantages of the framework. There are small animations of shadows and image overlays. The magnifying glass effect is used to show a more detailed image.

jobs.name: Shopping Cart
jobs.description: Simulate the purchasing process in an e-commerce. You can add, modify and delete the product from the shopping cart. You can see the product in details. There are several filters to list products.

jobs.name: Multi step form
jobs.description: In the challenge, a form had to be created where the form was shown in steps, the user had to be allowed to go to the previous step if they had already gone through it and at the end show the user's data.

jobs.name: Memory Game
jobs.description: The challenge is, using any frontend and styling technology, to recreate a memory game. Errors, successes and the time it took the user to play the game had to be shown.
